Class JLabelFixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractComponentFixture<S,T,D>
      • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJComponentFixture<S,T,D>
        • org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture<JLabelFixture,JLabel,JLabelDriver>
          • org.assertj.swing.fixture.JLabelFixture
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JComponentFixture<JLabelFixture>, JPopupMenuInvokerFixture, MouseInputSimulationFixture<JLabelFixture>, TextDisplayFixture<JLabelFixture>

    public class JLabelFixture
extends AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture<JLabelFixture,JLabel,JLabelDriver>
implements TextDisplayFixture<JLabelFixture>
    Supports functional testing of JLabels.
    Author:
    Alex Ruiz

        Creates a new JLabelFixture.

        robot - performs simulation of user events on the given JLabel.

      • JLabelFixture

        public JLabelFixture(@Nonnull
             Robot robot,
             @Nullable
             String labelName)
        Creates a new JLabelFixture.
        Parameters:
        robot - performs simulation of user events on a JLabel.
        labelName - the name of the JLabel to find using the given Robot.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if robot is null.
        ComponentLookupException - if a matching JLabel could not be found.
        ComponentLookupException - if more than one matching JLabel is found.
